nodes.bodyText:
Could it be this? https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-36804
"If auto-submit runs after excepted due date while excepted student is in quiz, quiz is not auto-submitted"
It seems that's the jira where that condition was originally added, then it was moved to other places.

Seems like you added it in
SAM-3313 autosubmit job needs to process excepted late allowed submissions (#5024)

Yeah, but I think I extracted it from the query and added the Java condition instead because otherwise more cases than due were being filtered. I can't remember it very well tbh, but I'd say it can happen, maybe settings being modified afterwards?

I'm not sure, it seems a little strange. If the settings were modified to allow further submissions, I would think this would involve extending the retract date also, so I'm not sure how you could get a submission attempt date after the retract date. Maybe exceptions?

Yeah I keep thinking it was just a crude way to sense an exception? I don't know if we should remove it. What do you guys think? I can't say I've ever come across a submission that was not submitted because of this clause. But it doesn't look right either.
Yeah, I'm a little torn. On one hand, we haven't seen issues that this condition causes, but yet it doesn't seem like it should be there logically.

Okay, let's leave it unless Bernardo thinks it should be removed.
Can I get an approval on this PR? It fixes an important bug.
Yes, I'd leave it. And sorry for not approving it before, thought some other reviewer had already done it!
